member.name: T:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader
member.summary: This class contain the main funtionality of the ds30 Loader engine.

member.name: T:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.BootLoaderProperties
member.summary: This structure represents the boot loader properties.

member.name: T:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.Response
member.summary: Contains the supported responses from the boot loader firmware.

member.name: F:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.HelloCharacter
member.summary: The hello character

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.Abort
member.summary: Aborts the current operation if any.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.CheckInitialized
member.summary: Throws an exception if ds30 Loader is not initialized.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.GetExpandedResetCommand(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets the expanded reset command, $PICID $GUIID are expanded to their values.
member.param: If set to true extended frames are assumed.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.FindLoader(ds30Loader.clsds30Device,ds30Loader.clsds30Settings,ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.BootLoaderProperties@,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Establishes communication with the boot loader and reads firmware version and device id.
member.param: The tab level of the output text.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.Initialize(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Initializes the ds30 Loader engine.
member.param: Unused, should be set to string.Empty.
The tab level of the outputted text.
Returns true if the initialization was successful.
member.remarks: During initialization the port plugins are read and the device database is initialized.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.InitializePorts(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Initializes the port plugins.
member.param: Unused, should be set to string.Empty.
The tab level of the outputted text.
Returns true if the initialization was successful.
member.remarks: This function is only called to refresh the port list.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.ReadDevice(System.Object[])
member.summary: Reads flash and eeprom contents.
member.remarks: Thus function is available to support threaded operation in VB.NET. A thread entry can't have more than one argument. The variables passed in the object array must match the function argument list.

example.code: Dim param_obj(5) As Object param_obj(0) = objDevice param_obj(1) = objHex param_obj(2) = objds30Settings param_obj(3) = iTabLevel param_obj(4) = bFlashResult param_obj(5) = bFlashResult Dim worker_thread As New Thread(AddressOf ReadDevice) worker_thread.Start(param_obj)

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.ReadDevice(ds30Loader.clsds30Device,ds30Loader.clsds30Hex,ds30Loader.clsds30Settings,System.Int32,System.Boolean@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Reads flash and eeprom contents.
member.param: The hex object to store read data in.
The tab level of text output.
Returns true if flash was read succesfully.
Returns true if eeprom was read succesfully.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.WriteDevice(System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes a to a using a .
member.remarks: Thus function is available to support threaded operation in VB.NET. A thread entry can't have more than one argument. The variables passed in the object array must match the function argument list.

example.code: Dim param_obj(4) As Object param_obj(0) = objDevice param_obj(1) = objHex param_obj(2) = objds30Settings param_obj(3) = iTabLevel param_obj(4) = result Dim worker_thread As New Thread(AddressOf WriteDevice) worker_thread.Start(param_obj)

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.WriteDevice(ds30Loader.clsds30Device,ds30Loader.clsds30Hex,ds30Loader.clsds30Settings,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Writes a to a using a .
member.param: The hex file object to write.
The tab level of the information output.
Returns true if the write succeds; otherwise false.

members.member:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
The boot loader size in pages. The device. The boot loader placement in pages from the end. The ds30 settings object to copy parse settings from.*/ An instance of the class

Initializes a new instance of the class.
The boot loader size in pages. The device. The boot loader properties. The boot loader placement in pages from the end. The ds30 settings object to copy parse settings from.*/ An instance of the class

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.version
member.summary: Gets the version.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Loader.separateThread
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether ds30 Loader is executed in a separate thread.
member.value: true if ds30 Loader is executed in a separate thread; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Settings this to true does not mean that ds30 Loader will automatically be run in a separate thread. When set to false Application.DoEvent() is called in loops.

member.name: T:ds30Loader.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The namespace contains classes and types that are used to interact with the ds30 Loader and the ds30 Secure boot loaders.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. All settings default to a disabled/safe value.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.portName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the port to be used for communication with the device.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.baudRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the baud rate.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.flowControl
member.summary: Gets or sets the flow control mode.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.stopBits
member.summary: Gets or sets the stop bits mode.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.parity
member.summary: Gets or sets the parity mode.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.remoteId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the device to read from/write to in the CAN or I2C bus.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for CAN ports.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.localId
member.summary: Gets or sets the CAN id of ds30 Loader application.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for CAN ports.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.canExtended
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether CAN extended frames should be send/received or not.
member.value: true if this instance can extended; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for CAN ports.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.canDlc
member.summary: Gets or sets the CAN data lengt code.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for CAN ports. Not all boot loader firmwares support dlc greater than one.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.address
member.summary: Gets or sets the address.
member.value: The address. This property is only valid for TCP/IP port.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.writeFlash
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether flash contents from the hex file should be written.
member.value: true if the flash memory is written; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.writeEeprom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether eeprom contents from the hex file should be written.
member.value: true if the eeprom memory is written; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.readFlash
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether flash contents should be read.
member.value: true if the flash memory is read; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.readEeprom
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether eeprom should be read.
member.value: true if the eeprom memory is rad; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.writeConfigs
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether configuration bits should be written or not.
member.value: true if configuration words are written; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.allowBlOverwrite
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether overwriting the boot loader is permitted or not. The boot loader protection in firmware is not bypassed.
member.value: true if overwrite of the boot loader is allowed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.noGotoUserApp
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the goto to the user application should be ignored or not.
member.value: true if the goto to the user application is not written; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.customBl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether custom boot loader properties should be used.
member.value: true if custom boot loader properties are used; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.customBlPlacementP
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom boot loader placement in pages from the end of the flash.
member.value: The custom boot loader placement in pages from the end of the flash.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.customBlSizeP
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom boot loader size in pages.
member.value: The custom boot loader size in pages.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.autoBaudrate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the auto baud rate sequence should be performed.
member.value: true if auto baud rate is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Auto baud rate detection mus be enabled in the firmware. This property is only valid for serial ports.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.echoVerification
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether echo verification should be used or not.
member.value: true if echo verification is enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for serial ports.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.addChecksum
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a checksum should be added in the flash.
member.value: true if a checksum checksum should be added; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The checksum is added just before the goto to the boot loader.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.dontWriteEmptyPages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether empty pages should be written or not.
member.value: true if empty pages should not be written; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.noGotoBl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the goto to the boot loader at 0x0 should be set or not.
member.value: true if the goto to the boot loader should not be set; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.helloTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the hello timeout in milliseconds.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.polltime
member.summary: Gets or sets the polltime in milliseconds.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout in milliseconds.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.portOpenDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay that is issued after the port is opened.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.resetCommand
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a reset command should be used.
member.value: true if reset command is sent prior to read and write operations; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.resetCommandSequence
member.summary: Gets or sets the reset command sequence.
member.remarks: For CAN ports the $PICID and $GUIID macro may be used. They will be expanded to a two or four byte big endian value.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.resetBaudRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the reset baud rate.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.resetDtr
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the device should be reset by enabling the DTR pin.
member.value: true if reset by DTR should be enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for serial ports. The DTR pin is held high by

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.resetRts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the device should be reset by enabling the RTS pin briefly.
member.value: true if reset by RTS shoud be enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for serial ports. The RTS pin is held high by

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.resetTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the reset time.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.resetId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the device to send the reset command to.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for CAN ports.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.resetCanDlc
member.summary: Gets or sets the CAN DLC to use when sending the reset command. O=use canDlc parameter.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for CAN ports.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.resetCanExtended
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether CAN extended frames should be send/received or not for the reset command.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for CAN ports.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.activateDtr
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the DTR pin should be enabled prior to read or write operation.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for serial ports.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.activateRts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the RTS pin should be enabled prior to read or write operation.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for serial ports.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30Settings.password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password to send before any write or read operation is performed.
member.remarks: This property is only valid for ds30 Secure Loader when used together with a ds30 Secure Loader firmware.

member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.summary: Converts a strings to a byte array.

member.returns: The byte array representation of the string.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Hex.ParseHexFile(ds30Loader.clsds30ParseSettings,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Parses the hex file.
member.param: If set to true the hex file is reparsed even it is not necessary.
The tab level of the output.
Is set to true if the parsing succeds; otherwisefalse.
member.remarks:
The following operations take place during the parsing of a hex file:
The hex file is validated; line checksums, file format and file completeness is checked. If an error is detected the parsing is aborted.
All data found in the hex-file that fits in the selected devices memory areas are stored in the , , and buffers. The , , , and arrays indicates which data was found.
If the hex file is not encrypted the goto to the application at the reset vector(0x0) is looked for. If it is found and the hex file does not contain signed data, the goto is moved to the first few words just before the boot loader start address. If the goto is not found the property is cleared.
A GOTO to the boot loader is inserted in the first words at 0x00 if the following conditions are true: it's not a 32-bit device, page 0 is used, data is not encrypted, and data is not signed.
If is set to true a checksum of the flash memory is calculated and inserted just before the goto to the user application.
If is set all empty pages are marked as unused.
The flash, eeprom, and configuration word data is counted, the results are stored in the , , , , properties.
Check of boot loader collision. If data found in the hex-file belong to the same memory space as the boot loader the property is cleared.

member.name: T:ds30Loader.clsds30ParseSettings
member.summary: This class contains settings used to parse a hex file.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30ParseSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30ParseSettings.#ctor(ds30Loader.clsds30Device,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Wether the boot loader properties are guessed or confirmed.
The boot loader size in pages.
The boot loader placement in pages from the end.
if set to true the boot loader is located in the aux or boot flash.
if set to true overwrite of the boot loader is ignored.
if set to true the goto to the user application is not set.
if set to true a checksum is added just before the goto to the user application.
if set to true write of the last page of PIC18FJf and PIC24FJ devices is enabled.
if set to true empty pages are disabled.
if set to true the goto to the boot loader at 0x0 is not set.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30ParseSettings.guessedBlProperties
member.summary: Gets or sets wether the boot loader properties are guessed or confirmed.
member.value: The boot loader placement in pages from the end of the flash.
member.remarks: This should always be set to false when parsing a hex file prior to writing it to a device. Setting it to true causes boot loader overwriting check to be disabled.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30ParseSettings.blPlacementP
member.summary: Gets or sets the boot loader placement in pages from the end of the flash.
member.value: The boot loader placement in pages from the end of the flash.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30ParseSettings.blSizeP
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the boot loader in pages.
member.value: The boot loader size in pages.

member.name: P:ds30Loader.clsds30ParseSettings.blInAuxBootFlash
member.summary: Gets or sets wether the bl is located in the aux or boot boot flash.
member.value: The bl in aux boot flash.

member.name: M:ds30Loader.clsds30Ports.GetPortObjectFromName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the port object from a port name.
member.returns: Returns the port object with the specified name. If it's not found and the serial port plugin is available a serial port with the specified name is returned.

returns true if the operation was successful.
